June 2020: Armed ISWAP fighters entered the village, which hosts several international NGOs. The group overran government forces, killing at least 40 soldiers and 20 civilians before reaching the humanitarian hub, where over 50 aid workers were present at the time. All UN and INGO vehicles in front of the humanitarian hub, which includes offices and accommodation, were set ablaze. Protective security measures deployed at the hub prevented any harm to the staff inside. Though the facility only sustained light damage, initial reports indicate that it was directly targeted, as an unexploded projectile was found at the gate. The perpetrators distributed letters to residents, warning them not to work with the military or international aid groups. One UN staff sustained injuries whilst escaping to the bunk during the attack. The staff died several weeks later due to the trauma.

May 2020: 24 people were killed and 20 more were injured after gunmen wearing police uniforms stormed an INGO-supported maternity ward. An INGO midwife was also reportedly killed. At least three perpetrators were killed. Over 100 people, including nurses and foreign aid workers, were evacuated from the facility. The INGO announced its decision to end activities and withdraw from the medical facility.

The military disputed the report, stating that it had killed 12 Taliban fighters in the village. The strike came after government troops were killed in a Taliban ambush.
October 2020: An empty maternity ward was damaged by an Azerbaijani rocket.
October 2020: A volunteer was killed when his car was hit by an alleged Armenian rocket. Two female workers injured.

October 2020: An unidentified perpetrator wearing an explosive vest detonated himself near a private higher education centre, which he had tried to enter, killing at least 24 people, most of whom were students waiting to enter the facility, and injuring dozens of others. ISIS claimed responsibility for the attack, adding that their target was a group of Shias.
October 2020: Eight students were killed, and 136 wounded many of whom were children when a blast of unidentified origin struck the seminary
October 2020: Israeli Defence Forces struck 2 Hezbollah posts and a vehicle, damaging a nearby school.
October 2020: Artillery shells hit a school, damaging the yard.
30 October 2020: Artillery shells hit a school, damaging the building.
October 2020: Artillery shells of unknown origin hit houses in the vicinity of a school.
October 2020: The vicinity of a school was hit by artillery shells, killing one civilian and wounding seven others, including children.
October 2020: A school was hit by artillery shells killing a child and injuring  five civilians
April 2020: Casualties were reported after unidentified airstrikes reportedly hit a medical dispensary.
April 2020: A neurosurgeon was killed after suspected Libyan National Army artillery shells reportedly landed on his home.
April 2020: A medical facility was deemed non-functional after it was severely damaged by shelling during continuous military activities. No injuries reported.
April 2020: Five paramedics were injured and two field medical facilitys were damaged by Libyan National Army Grad rockets.
April 2020: A medical facility was destroyed in a targeted attack by Libyan National Army artillery.
April 2020: Casualties were reported after Libyan National Army airstrikes allegedly struck headquarters.
April 2020: Two people were killed and two ambulances were destroyed by Government of National Accord or Turkish airstrikes.
April 2020: Services at a Polyclinic were suspended after it was hit by shelling from an unidentified source.
May 2020: Several civilian casualties were reported after a suspected Turkish airstrike allegedly hit a building containing a medical team responsible for combatting COVID-19.
May 2020: A patient was injured after a suspected Turkish army drone allegedly targeted an ambulance.
May 2020: Fourteen civilians were injured after suspected Libyan National Army artillery allegedly targeted a medical facility and the surrounding residential area with rockets.
August 2020: The Faculty of Engineering was hit by artillery shells.
June 2020: A doctor was killed in her home by a mortar shell from an unidentified source.
28 April 2020: Windows and furniture of a school were damaged as a result of shelling.
May 2020: Fourteen people were injured and a medical facility was damaged by indirect shelling.
April 2020: School windows were shattered with shrapnel
March 2020: A school was damaged due to hostilities and a girl was injured by shrapnel in Oleksandrivka Donetska NGCA
March 2020: Kindergarten sustained light damages in Oleksandrivka Donetska
October 2020: Two INGO aid workers were kidnapped by armed bandits in a road ambush. The vehicle in which they were travelling was abandoned and later retrieved by the INGO.
April 2020: Two health workers were injured and a pregnant woman miscarried after an attack by Libyan National Army troops who fired artillery shells.
October 2020: An ambulance transporting wounded people was targeted by Azerbaijani armed forces.
October 2020: A military medical facility complex was destroyed by rockets and cluster bombs. Several vehicles in the medical facility parking lot.
May 2020: A doctor was killed due to a shelling of unidentified origin.
June 2020: Five people were killed after a suspected Libyan National Army airstrike reportedly targeted an ambulance as well as several Government of National Accord vehicles.

October 2020: A South Sudanese LNGO aid worker was reportedly killed after being caught in crossfire while harvesting crops from his farm. Initial reports suggest the gunfire is attributed to disputing clans in the area.
October 2020: A medical centre, treating COVID-19 patients, was damaged by an Azerbaijani rocket.
October 2020: An LNGO driver was shot dead reportedly due to armed inter-communal cattle clashes.
October 2020: An LNGO aid worker was arrested during a police raid on his home. He was released the following day under judicial supervision.
November 2020: 20 students were wounded  when a University was struck during an airstrike by the Ethiopian National Defence Forces
October 2020: Two LNGO volunteers were injured by bomb remnants as they were working to extinguish fires.
March 2020: Six people were injured after Libyan National forces shelled a prison.
April 2020: An airplane carrying medical assistance was targeted by the GNA air force.
April 2020: Indiscriminate shells fired by presumed LNA forces struck a medical clinic injuring an unspecified number of civilians.
May 2020: Airstrikes by US and Afghan military forces hit the CHC heath center while there were civilians inside.
Reported Perpetrator Name: Afghan National Security Forces, US Military

Event Description: October 2020: Two LNGO volunteers and their driver were injured after the car they were travelling in from a project site was hit by shrapnel resulting from a drone attack on another car travelling in the area.
October 2020: An LNGO volunteer was arrested by Hayâ€™at Tahrir al Sham as he visited the office of the militant group.
October 2020: A male volunteer was injured in an armed attack by unidentified gunmen.
October 2020: A female aid worker and an unspecified number of civilians were kidnapped by gunmen.
November 2020: Unidentified perpetrators placed a bomb on the surrounding wall of an unnamed private university, which then detonated, killing one student and injured nine.
January 2020: An LNGO volunteer was killed by alleged Syrian or Russian rockets.
January 2020: An LNGO volunteer was killed by missiles fired by Syrian regime warplanes.
Reported Perpetrator Name: Armed Forces of the Russian Federation

Event Description: January 2020: Two LNGO volunteers were injured when Russian warplanes carried out airstrikes on the area. Regime helicopters dropped barrel bombs on the town as well.
Reported Perpetrator Name: Armed Forces of the Russian Federation, Syrian Armed Forces

Event Description: February 2020: Russian warplanes fired missiles at a Surgical medical facility, damaging its building and equipment.
Reported Perpetrator Name: Armed Forces of the Russian Federation

Event Description: February 2020:Russian warplanes carried out airstrikes, while pro-regime ground forces shelled the town as well, damaging civilian homes and a mosque. The attack also damaged a clinic, it's building, and its equipment. Six civilians were wounded. No fatalities were reported.
Reported Perpetrator Name: Armed Forces of the Russian Federation

Event Description: February 2020: A male LNGO volunteer was killed in a bombing by Russian warplanes on the town.
February 2020: A bombing from an unknown source struck 300 meters away from the Al Nour medical facility, causing minor damage to it and forcing it to close.
February 2020: Unidentified perpetrators attacked a medical facility and a primary health care centre causing major structural damage and forcing them to close.
February 2020: Syrian regime artillery shelled a medical dispensary, damaging the building.
February 2020: An LNGO ambulance driver was killed and an LNGO volunteer injured in a bombing by Russian warplanes.
Reported Perpetrator Name: Armed Forces of the Russian Federation

Event Description: February 2020: Russian warplanes bombed a clearly marked ambulance, killing three paramedics on board as they were heading to assist victims of airstrikes.
Reported Perpetrator Name: Armed Forces of the Russian Federation

Event Description: February 2020: Russian warplanes fired missiles near a Medical Center, damaging the building and the equipment contained inside.
Reported Perpetrator Name: Armed Forces of the Russian Federation

Event Description: February 2020: Airstrikes and ground attacks of unidentified origin struck a medical facility, injuring three nurses and a doctor, and heavily damaging the facility. The medical facility, which served 11,500 patients monthly, was forced to shut down.
February 2020: Alleged Russian airstrikes hit a maternity and children's medical facility, causing significant damage to its building, and injuring two health workers.
Reported Perpetrator Name: Armed Forces of the Russian Federation

Event Description: October 2020: An INGO aid worker was kidnapped by armed men.

October 2020: Two LNGO aid workers, one Burundian refugee, and one Congolese contractor were kidnapped when their vehicle was ambushed by armed men dressed in military attire. Reportedly, the abductors demanded a ransom of 50,000 USD.
November 2020: A school girl was killed on her way to school by exploding artillery shells reportedly fired by the Syrian military.
February 2020: Allegedly Russian warplanes fired missiles, damaging a medical facility.
Reported Perpetrator Name: Armed Forces of the Russian Federation

Event Description: February 2020: A male pharmacist was killed in a Russian or Syrian airstrike.
February 2020: Russian warplanes hit an ambulance, rendering it unusable.
Reported Perpetrator Name: Armed Forces of the Russian Federation

Event Description: November 2020: A school building was damaged by artillery shells fired by Syrian military
October 2020: Two UN aid workers were shot and killed by suspected al Shabaab militants while carrying out a health awareness campaign.
October 2020: An LNGO aid worker was reportedly shot and killed by al Shabaab militants.

October 2020: A Somalian LNGO aid worker was injured by a VBIED that was passing nearby. The IED was placed on a vehicle carrying the district chief who was the intended target and was killed along with his bodyguard.
February 2020: Russian warplanes fired missiles at a Children's and Women's medical facility, destroying the building.
Reported Perpetrator Name: Armed Forces of the Russian Federation

Event Description: February 2020: Syrian regime warplanes fired missiles near a medical facility, damaging the building and equipment contained within.
February 2020: Syrian regime artillery fired shells near a medical facility, damaging its building and equipment.
October 2020: One INGO aid worker was killed and another injured when unidentified armed men attacked a team of INGO aid workers as they were returning to Pibor.

October 2020: An LNGO aid worker was shot and killed by armed youth as he was on his way from the NGO base to a facility providing supplementary feeding and outpatient therapeutic care to malnourished children and new mothers. His colleague escaped with minor injuries.
November 2020: A Congolese LNGO aid worker was reportedly shot and killed by unidentified perpetrators.
November 2020: Gunmen attacked an INGO aid worker and amputated his arm. In response, the aid organisation temporarily suspended its activities in the area.
March 2020: An ambulance drove over an IED, injuring seven civilians onboard.
February 2020: Pro-Houthi forces shelled two medical facilitys, causing serious damage to both buildings. No fatalities or injuries were reported.

November 2020: Four Ethiopian INGO aid workers were killed in Tigray near the border with Eritrea last month during fighting in the northern region. The circumstances of their deaths were unclear, but they took place in one of four camps for Eritrean refugees. There are unconfirmed reports that a fifth aid worker had also died in Tigray.   (
August 2020: A UN staff member was shot and killed in his home.

November 2020: At least six INGO aid workers were kidnapped by gunmen who fired at the civilian vehicle they were travelling in. All hostages, except one, were released on the same day. The remaining aid worker from the Tuareg community was released the following day.
July 2020: Two male LNGO aid workers were killed after a vehicle-borne IED exploded in the area.
November 2020: A vehicle belonging to a health INGO was attacked by armed men, leaving three employees injured.

November 2020: A male volunteer and two local state officials were kidnapped at a checkpoint set up on the road by Islamic State West Africa, Province (ISWAP) between Kareto and Gubio. The group claimed responsibility for the abduction via its propaganda news outlet, Amaq.
January 2020: An NGO health worker was reportedly killed, along with three other civilians, during a clash between youth from Meen and Wundhiot, Rumbek East, over cattle.
June 2020: A LNGO aid worker, while gathering his cattle in Mabior village, was caught in a cattle raid and killed. The motive is not reportedly related to his status as an aid worker.

November 2020: Some humanitarian actors were forced to suspend their activities due to conflict between the Afghan National Security Forces and NSAGs. A health facility able to serve 30,000 people remained closed.
November 2020: A volunteer was stopped and detained by an unidentified armed group while on his way back from a family visit in Kabul. He was released and safely returned home.

November 2020: Two volunteers were injured when a group of IDF soldiers attacked an ambulance and team whilst the staff were providing first aid to a person who had sustained rubber-coated bullet injuries. As stun and teargas grenades were thrown at the ambulance, several soldiers boarded the vehicle and attempted to arrest the patient by force.
January 2020: A male national LNGO aid worker was killed during Syrian regime airstrikes of an industrial area in east Idlib.
November 2020: A male IDP who served as a INGO security guard was shot dead by unknown gunmen in the fifth sector of al Hol camp.
Febraury 2020: A male volunteer sustained a rubber coated bullet wound to the head as he was covering the Arma/Bita (Nablus) clashes.
March 2020: Artillery shells of unidentified origin hit a medical facility.
March 2020: Airstrikes of an unidentified origin hit a COVID-19 quarantine centre.
February 2020: 17 students were injured when an artillery shell hit a school in a northern township
December 2020: A childrens medical facility and a centre for special needs was damaged by a strike friom Israeli forces. Two wounded.
May 2020: A volunteer paramedic was attacked by two men who beat him, made him kneel on the ground, threw chlorine/bleach on him, and told him not to spread COVID-19 in the area.
October 2020: Health staff were prevented from accessing a health clinic due to the presence of IEDs, forcing it to close.
October 2020: Health staff were prevented from accessing a health clinic due to the presence of IEDs, forcing it to close as well as two others in the area.
November 2020: A medical complex and several buildings damaged by 23 rockets. A nurse was thrown off her feet when the rocket struck the medical facility. Eight people killed and 31 others wounded.
In Ariha city, Idlib governorate, artillery shells fired by the Syrian military hit and damaged two ambulances belonging to an LNGO.
Novermber 2020: A male LNGO volunteer and a male driver were killed by Syrian regime forces artillery shelling that struck the car they were travelling in.
January 2020: A female LNGO aid worker was killed in her home after three consecutive air strikes hit the town of Ariha
May 2020: A male INGO aid worker was shot and killed by unidentified perpetrators.
February 2021: A nurse was critically injured when gunmen fired at an INGO ambulance responding to an emergency call.

December 2020: A UN team were fired at by the Ethiopian National Defence Force who detained four UN team members, claiming that they had ignored instructions and driven through two federal government checkpoints without permission.

January 2020: Russian Syrian Military Coalition airstrikes completely destroyed an INGO supported medical facility. Four nurses were killed in the attack, along with another female NGO employee who happened to be in the facility.
December 2020: Two volunteers were kidnaped by ISWAP militants at a checkpoint as they returned from a wedding in neighbouring Adamawa state
December 2020: An LNGO aid worker was  kidnapped, robbed, and severely beaten by unidentified gunmen before being left in a farm in the suburbs.
December 2020:  An LNGO aid worker was briefly kidnapped by Ambazonian separatists who extorted him of his money before letting him go.
March 2020: Artillery shells of unidentified origin hit a medical facility.
April 2020: Artillery shells of unidentified origin hit an unnamed medical centre.
October 2020: A medical centre was hit by artillery shells.
December 2020: A volunteer compound was broken into by armed perpetrators who looted equipment and veterinary products. Three injured.
December 2020: An off-duty INGO aid worker and several civilians were killed when their public transport truck was caught in the crossfire of gunmen.
December 2020: An INGO office was raided, robbed and damaged by unidentified fighters who also shot and wounded the INGO guard.
December 2020: A male INGO aid worker was killed while on duty in Hitsats Refugee Camp.
February 2020: An INGO guard was tied up and injured by a group of armed men who broke into an INGO office and stole items.
December 2020: An NGO vehicle was hijacked along with its driver and passengers by unknown gunmen. The passengers were released soon after and the driver on the following day.

December 2020: At least four food aid workers were beaten and an armoured military Buffalo vehicle belonging to the INGO was stolen when its headquarters  was attacked by six gunmen driving a Land Cruiser.
September 2020: Two NGO aid workers were killed and one injured after a vehicle-borne IED driven by an unknown suicide bomber exploded.

December 2020: Three volunteers were killed and three others were injured following an explosion attributed to Houthi forces. The staff were transiting through the airport with other civilians when the explosion occurred shortly after a plane carrying members of the country's newly formed government arrived from neighbouring Saudi Arabia.
November 2020: An aid worker was stabbed in the hand in a kidnapping attempt at his home by anti-Balaka militants.
November 2020: Three INGO aid workers were kidnapped by armed men during an ambush. Their vehicle was left behind and the aid workers were reportedly freed on 13 November.
December 2020: A Spanish INGO worker was kidnapped by unidentified armed individuals at an illegal checkpoint. The victim was released two days later.
December 2020: A male UN aid worker was shot and wounded by an unknown perpetrator when  driving home after completing bank transactions.
December 2020: A VBIED was detonated outside a medical facility.
June 2020: Three LNGO aid workers, a security guard, and a government employee were kidnapped during an ambush by ISWAP. All the victims were later executed in mid-July 2020.

December 2020: An ambulance, carrying a pregnant woman, was set on fire through the detonation of an IED set by al Shabaab militants. The husband of the expectant mother died in the attack, while a nurse and the ambulance driver were left with injuries.
November 2020: Two Malian aid workers were kidnapped by suspected extremist militants while travelling by boat.
November 2020: Two male aid workers were robbed, beaten and injured during a raid on their compound by three perpetrators.
November 2020: An off-duty INGO driver was shot and killed while walking with a group of people in the early morning.

November 2020: Two LNGO aid workers were arrested by police as they were carrying out a needs assessment for flood victims. They were taken to a cell, where they were reportedly subjected to harsh conditions. They were both released the following day.
November 2020: A male LNGO volunteer was wounded when unexploded ordnance from a previous shelling exploded.
December 2020: An INGO staff was reportedly kidnapped while travelling in Borno.
March 2020: A malel LNGO volunteer was kidnapped by armed oppositions fighters while working in the area.
April 2020: Airstrikes from an unidentified source hit another medical quarantine centre.
June 2020: A medical facility was hit by artillery shells. Two civilians were injured.
May 2020: A field clinic was hit by artillery shells.
June 2020: Two doctors of the Field Medicine and Support Centre were killed when an unexploded ordnance detonated while they were on-duty evacuating injured patients.
June 2020: An airstrike from an unidentified source hit an ambulance point, significantly damaging the facility and an ambulance.
May 2020: Airstrikes by US and Afghan military forces hit a medical facility, killing two patients.

Event Description: August 2020: An LNGO driver and his assistant were ambushed and kidnapped by JNIM militants whilst transporting supplies. They were released two days later.

November 2020: Two schools were found to have antipersonnel mines during mine inspections at schools across the municipality
April 2020: Artillery shells of unidentified origin hit an unnamed medical facility.

October 2020: Three INGO aid workers were reportedly kidnapped by unknown armed perpetrators. Their driver, who was also kidnapped, was released immediately and the remaining three staff were released 4 days later.
October 2020: A health clinic was forced to close due to the presence of IEDs.
November 2020: Staff at a medical facility fled from the building, due to conflict.

Event Description: January 2021: A UN staff member was among 20-50 other civlians kidnapped by Boko Haram militants who stormed the Damaturu-Maiduguri Road in military uniforms and mounted a roadblock with three Hilux vans and motorcycles. The staff member was released in June 2021.

February 2020: A male LNGO volunteer was kidnapped after leaving his house by al-Qaeda affiliate Guardians of Religion Organisation.

January 2021: Three INGO aid workers were injured when CPC rebel group attacked an INGO convoy composed of approximately 30 trucks, as well as other commercial vehicles, as they tried to cross the border into the Central African Republic.
January 2021: An INGO guard was shot and killed by an armed perpetrator while walking near an INGO warehouse. The killing is allegedly due to a personal revenge
January 2021: Two volunteers were wounded in an armed attack.

January 2021: Five LNGO aid workers were arrested by the Directorate of Military Counter Intelligence over charges related to the Computer Crime Law and the Law against Organised Crime and the Financing of Terrorism. A sixth aid worker was also arrested, but was later released without charges.
January 2021: Three aid workers were among a total of up to 200 people killed during four attacks carried out by Rizeigat militiamen against Masalit IDPs over two days.
March 2021: At least one staff member was wounded when the offices of a health LNGO were raided by police. Computers and phones were seized.

March 2021: Two LNGO volunteers were arrested by security forces while tending to wounded protesters. One volunteer was beaten with batons and one was shot in the thigh qne their ambulance destroyed. Both volunteers were released.

January 2021: An LNGO aid worker was traveling when he was shot and wounded in the crossfire of an unspecified conflict.
March 2021: Three LNGO aid workers were arrested by Myanmar military soldiers who fired at the ambualnce they were travelling in.
March 2021: Two INGO volunteers were injured and detained. Several other incidences have been reported.
January 2021: An LNGO aid worker was assaulted, robbed and injured by youths.
January 2021: An LNGO aid worker was killed and another injured when armed youth attacked the vehicle they were travelling in.
March 2021: Three LNGO aid workers were arrested by SAC forces.
March 2021: Two LNGO medics were shot and killed by security forces while tending to injured protesters.
March 2021: An LNGO volunteer was shot and killed by security forces, while he was on the way to assist student protesters who had been rounded up by police and soldiers.
April 2021: Nine volunteers were detained during a raid by SAC forces on an LNGO clinic.

Event Description: April 2021: A locally-run prosthetic clinic was destroyed by military airstrikes.
March 2021: Four LNGO medics were detained by military forces whilst treating injured protesters. One medic was released a few days later whilst the other three remained missing.
February 2021: An LNGO staff member was killed in unspecified circumstances.
February 2021: An NGO worker was kidnapped for ransom.
February 2021: A male INGO aid worker was killed by gunmen.

March 2021: Five INGO aid workers travelling in a convoy were reportedly kidnapped by an armed group. The perpetrators looted the aid workers goods and released the victims hours later following the intervention of the FARDC.
March 2021: Three INGO aid workers were kidnapped by unidentified perpetrators while on a mission in the locality.
April 2021: An LNGO doctor and ambulance driver were arrested during a raid on a clinic by SAC forces.
February 2021: At least two LNGO aid workers were arrested by police and Myanmar military soldiers.

March 2021: Medics were injured, ambulances, medical equipment and internationally-recognised volunteerflags destoryed, by security forced amid anti-military junta demonstrations in an unspecified location in Myanmar.

March 2021: Four LNGO volunteers were forced from their ambulance and beaten with rifles by at least six police officers.The police officers fired their weapons into the ambulance. The volunteers were taken to Insein Prison.
March 2021: Three aid workers were attested by police and Myanmar military soldiers.
February 2021: Three INGO aid workers were attacked and wounded by gunmen.
February 2021: An INGO aid worker was killed in their tent at the Al-Hol camp.

February 2021: At least seven people were killed, including the daughter of an INGO employee. Around 30 people, including three INGO colleagues, were injured after a fire of unidentified origin broke out in a tent at the camp and spread to adjoining tents.

March 2021: At least seven aid workers were kidnapped and humanitarian facilities and other infrastructures run by NGO's destroyed by ISWAP insurgents. In response, humanitarian support to nearly 100,000 people was suspended.

February 2021: Artillery fired by unidentified perpetrators destroyed a high school. The boundary wall of the school, the schools walls, windows and almost all school equipment were destroyed, depriving 3,000 girls from accessing their classrooms.
February 2021: Two volunteers were attacked by locals during the burial of a suspected Ebola victim, causing serious injuries.

March 2021: A British-Iranian woman, formerly an employee of an international foundation, was charged with spreading propaganda less than a week after completing a 5-year sentence for similar accusations.

March 2021: After an investigation lasting almost four years, Italian prosecutors have charged 21 rescuers from three NGOs, who were accused of collaborating with people smugglers after saving thousands of people from drowning in the Mediterranean Sea.
March 2021: An INGO national aid worker was reportedly shot and injured by a member of the Coalition of Patriots for Change (CPC).
March 2021: An INGO aid worker was injured after picking up an UXO believed to have been left by ISIS.
March 2021: An INGO driver was beaten with the back of a gun by Ethiopian Armed Forces who threatened to kill him after stopping the clearly-marked INGO car he was travelling in.
March 2021: An LNGO aid worker was killed by a stray bullet amid fighting between the Nigerian Army and ISWAP fighters.
Reported Perpetrator Name: Islamic State West Africa Province, Nigerian Armed Forces

Event Description: March 2021:  A South Sudanese LNGO aid worker was shot and injured at a public location by an unidentified individual.
March 2021: A South Sudanese LNGO aid worker was shot and injured when his commercial vehicle was ambushed by gunmen as he returned to his duty station.
March 2021: A bomb exploded near an LNGO warehouse killing three people and injuring six others, including two LNGO aid workers.

March 2021: Seven patients and visitors were killed at an INGO-supported medical facility when it was hit by Russian military or Syrian Government rockets, at least 15  were injured, including five staff. The medical facility sustained major damage and is now out of service.
Reported Perpetrator Name: Armed Forces of the Russian Federation

Event Description: Near the Bab al-Hawa border crossing, Idlib governorate, Russian warplanes hit and set ablaze a warehouse supported by an INGO. The fire destroyed relief items for nearly 25,000 people in dire need of humanitarian assistance in northwest Syria. A second explosion in a truck parking lot led to a new, even larger fire, whereby thousands of relief supplies were burnt and destroyed.
Reported Perpetrator Name: Armed Forces of the Russian Federation

Event Description: February 2021: An INGO compound was stormed for the second consecutive day by about 20 armed men believed to be CPC. They looted the premises and shot a guard who tried to flee. The guard was injured.

February 2021: The Italian ambassador to the DRC, an Italian military police guard, and a WFP agency driver were killed, and a UN agency country director was  injured when a WFP convoy consisting of two UN agency vehicles was ambushed by unidentidied armed men.
February 2021: An INGO homestay in Maaji II Refugee Settlement suffered a grenade explosion which immediatelly killed 3 children and fatally injured 7 others.

March 2021: In Baalbek-Hermel governorate, following the death of a syrian herdsman as a result of a leftover mine in the Eastern mountain range INGO staff were instructed to continue avoiding the outskirts of Ras Baalback.
January 2020: An INGO aid worker was attacked and beaten by protesters.
January 20201: A children's medical facility was reportedl damaged by IDF warplanes in the Gaza strip.

February 2021: A male volunteer aid worker for a health organistaion was killed after an IED placed under the organisation's vehicle exploded. The driver and a second volunteer were wounded in the same attack.
April 2020: Twelve IDP relief volunteers and two drivers were arrested by the Myanmar Army. They were in the process of collecting 150 bags of rice from the town.
February 2021: A male LNGO contractor driver was shot and injured by unknown perpetrators.
February 2021: A male LNGO aid worker was retrieving his cows from a grazing area when a group of youths reportedly affiliated with the SPLA-IO seriously beat and seriously injured him.
Reported Perpetrator Name: SPLA-IO Sudan People's Liberation Army in Opposition

Event Description: February 2021: Unidentified perpetrators fired upon a vehicle carrying four female Pakistani aid workers affiliated with a programme for developing household skills for women. A fifth aid worker, also a woman, survived the attack by taking refuge in a nearby house.
March 2021: A driver and a student were killed and six others injured when a rocket struck a Baghlan University bus. The Taliban denied the attack.

January 2021: Two INGO aid workers travelling in an ambulance were stopped by an armed gang and forced out of the vehicle, as they were on their way to respond to an urgent call. The crew was interrogated, assaulted and threatened with guns, before managing to escape.
February 2021: 13 civilians were injured during a medical facility attack as a missile was fired from an Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF).

February 2021: Two NGO health workers were kidnapped by suspected Caparros members. The victims were released unharmed a day later following the deployment of additional military forces to search for the victims.

February 2021: Six INGO aid workers and a male health worker were kidnapped by JNIM militants. The three females were released and the men were kept detained. The team was released later in February.

March 2021: Three LNGO aid workers were arrested and betaen with guns by the Myanmar military and police arrested while tending to wounded protesters.

The gunmen took everything from the vehicle before setting it on fire. The perpetrators questioned the driver and the staff member before shooting and killing the driver. The staff member managed to escape.

Official reports indicate armed youth attempting to raid cattle near the village were met by police and three youths were killed in the clash. In retaliation, the mob of youth responded on the community killing two people including the INGO aid worker.

May 2020: An INGO truck driver was assaulted after he was forced to remain with a truck having mechanical problems through the night. During the night, 30 armed youths reportedly assaulted and robbed the driver.

May 2021: An explosion occurred outside of a medical facility. No fatalities were reported and it is unclear who perpetrated the attack.

October 2021: An LNGO vehicle was ambushed and robbed. One staff member was injured.

March 2021: A Houthi-run detention facility reportedly rounded up hundreds of migrants, mostly Ethiopian, and placed them in a hangar after they protested against overcrowding. The guards subsequently launched an unidentified projectile into the building, producing a lot of smoke and causing the eyes of those demonstrating to burn. A second projectile, described by the victims as a bomb, was then fired into the building, exploding and starting a fire. At least 44 people were killed, and 193 injured, half of whom remain in serious condition. As of March 10, increased security presence in hospitals had also been posing challenges for the IOM and other humanitarians to access the injured.

November 2022: In Marib governorate, shrapnel from six missiles/rockets fired by forces on an IRG weapons warehouse fell on an IDP camp. Four IDPs, including two children were killed and 23 others were injured, 13 IDP tents were damaged, three were burnt, and 53 water tanks were destroyed.

November 2022: In Maarrat Misrin subdistrict, Idlib district, Russian warplanes and Syrian artillery, dropped banned cluster munitions near four IDP camps located in close proximity to each other. At least nine civilians were killed and at least 75 others got injured. At least 400 families have been displaced anew as a result of such hostilities. Volunteers subsequently found and cleared 14 unexploded submunitions.

November 2022: In Ariha district, Russian warplanes and Syrian artillery, dropped banned cluster munitions near four IDP camps located in close proximity to each other. Volunteers subsequently found and cleared 14 unexploded submunitions.

09 February 2024: Nine Red Cross health workers, four patients and five patient companions were arrested by Israeli forces during a raid on a Red Cross medical facility. Soldiers destroyed medical devices; seized money, laptops and walkie-talkies; stole keys of ambulance and administrative vehicles and locked the steering wheels, preventing their operation. One ambulance was hit by direct fire and three vehicles were destroyed. On 16 February, two health workers were released and reported torture. On 28 March, the remaining seven were released.

She remained in captivity until the following evening, and suffered severe physical assault. She managed to persuade her captors to bring her to the hospital forr treatment, after losing consciousness following the assaults.

One paramedic was released soon after. The other two paramedics were only released on April 15th.

24 March 2024: Israeli forces surrounded a Red Cross medical facility, closed its gates with dirt barriers and fired smoke bombs towards its building to force medical staff, patients and displaced people to leave naked. A Red Cross emergency staff member and a patient were killed by gunfire during the raid and an EMT and a volunteer paramedic were arrested. In response, displaced people and patients were evacuated, with only special Red Cross crews, nine patients and 10 of their companions, and a family with children with special conditions remaining. On 26th, the medical facility suspended it's operations after more than a 40 day siege. The emergency department was re-opened on 15 April. On 13 May, the EMT and volunteer paramedic were released.

24 March 2024: Following an Israeli forced evacuation from a Red Cross medical facility, staff and patients could not pass the military checkpoint due to extensive bulldozing and destruction in the area. Two Red Cross staff were injured by Israeli open gunfire as they tried to remove the rubble. One was evacuated, a paramedic, while the second, an anaesthesia technician, could not be reached. Teams were then forced to return to the medical facility but found the gates were closed, leaving them in the street. The Red Cross crews eventually reached the city with patients after being trapped inside ambulances outside the medical facility for 20 hours. On April 7th, the body of the anaesthesia technician staff member who Red Cross were unable to reach, was found. On 11th April, the paramedic succumbed to his injuries.

The toxicology and trauma department of the medical facility was completely destroyed and its services suspended. Two adults were killed, including a female paediatric nephrologist who was evacuating children on dialysis to a shelter. 50 others, including seven children, a doctor and a nurse, were injured. 94 children were transferred to other medical facilitys in the city. On 10 July, one of the injured children died of his injuries in medical facility.

25 October 2024: A medical facility was raided by Israeli forces who opened fire inside. Three nurses and a cleaner were injured. Patients and staff were held without food or water and an all men, including 44 medical staff, were detained after being stripped; an INGO nursing director and INGO surgeon were among them.The medical facility director and 13 other staff were later released. The medical facility perimeter, three ambulances, a transport vehicle, medical supplies and its solar electric system were destroyed. When IDF withdrew the next day, only one paediatrician remained in the facility.

December 2024: A medical facility entrance was hit and damaged by Russian or Syrian airstrikes, killing 12 people, including two health workers, and injuring 23 others. An INGO ambulance driver was also injured. Ambulances were damaged, including one from a second INGO which was rendered out of service.
